Uses of Class
org.testfx.api.annotation.Unstable

  • Packages that use Unstable 
    Package Description

    • Uses of Unstable in org.testfx.api

      Classes in org.testfx.api with annotations of type Unstable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  FxAssert
      All TestFX tests should use FxAssert.verifyThat(Node, Matcher, Function) when writing tests, so that the developer can use DebugUtils to provide additional info as to why a test failed.
      class  FxAssertContext
      Stores contextual information for FxAssert: a NodeFinder, which defaults to FxServiceContext.getNodeFinder() a CaptureSupport, which defaults to FxServiceContext.getCaptureSupport()
      class  FxRobot 
      class  FxRobotContext
      Stores the robot implementations, the window and node finders, position calculators, and capture support for FxRobot.
      class  FxRobotException 
      interface  FxRobotInterface
      Wrapper-like interface that makes it easier to chain together multiple robot methods while adding a number of convenience methods, such as finding a given node, scene or window via a PointQuery, a Predicate, or a Matcher.
      class  FxService
      Wrapper class that holds a static FxServiceContext via FxService.serviceContext() that is lazily created.
      class  FxServiceContext
      Stores the following objects: a WindowFinder a NodeFinder a BaseRobot CaptureSupport
      class  FxToolkit
      Responsible for setup and cleanup of JavaFX fixtures that need the JavaFX thread.
      class  FxToolkitContext
      Stores the contextual information for FxToolkit: the PrimaryStageFuture the Application as a Class object the application's arguments the registered Stage the timeout limit for launching an application the timeout limit for setting up a component

      Methods in org.testfx.matcher.base with annotations of type Unstable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static org.hamcrest.Matcher<javafx.scene.Node> NodeMatchers.anything()
      Creates a matcher that matches everything (matches(Object) always returns true.
      static org.hamcrest.Matcher<javafx.scene.paint.Color> ColorMatchers.hasClosestNamedColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color namedColor)
      Creates a matcher that matches all Colors that are exactly equal to the given JavaFX named Color.
      static org.hamcrest.Matcher<javafx.scene.paint.Color> ColorMatchers.hasClosestNamedColor(java.lang.String namedColor)
      Creates a matcher that matches all Colors that have the given named color String their closest JavaFX named color.
      static org.hamcrest.Matcher<javafx.scene.paint.Color> ColorMatchers.isColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Creates a matcher that matches all Colors that are exactly equal to the given color.
      static org.hamcrest.Matcher<javafx.scene.paint.Color> ColorMatchers.isColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color color, ColorMatcher colorMatcher)
      Creates a matcher that matches all Colors that match the given color with respect to the given colorMatcher.
      static org.hamcrest.Matcher<javafx.scene.paint.Color> ColorMatchers.isColor(java.lang.String namedColor)
      Creates a matcher that matches all Colors that are exactly equal to the given JavaFX named color String.
